articles.title: Several killed in blast on Crimea college campus
articles.description: Authorities say that at least ten people have been killed and dozens injured as a result of an explosion at a vocational college in Kerch, Crimea.

articles.title: Man who ambushed police officers had nearly 130 guns in his home
articles.description: An ex-Army sharpshooter was found to have nearly 130 guns at his home in South Carolina after he ambushed police officers.

articles.title: Most top burger chains fail antibiotic test in new report
articles.description: Before you take another bite of that Big Mac, listen up! A recent collaborative report graded the top 25 U.S. burger chains on their antibiotic policies and only two chains passed with flying colors. Veuer's Mercer Morrison has the story.

articles.title: Pando, the world's largest organism is dying, study suggests
articles.description: One of the world's largest organisms -- a colony of tens of thousands of trees -- is dying, a new study finds. And humans might be at fault.
articles.content: The Pando clone at Fishlake National Forest in Utah. (Photo: Paul Rogers) Pando, a colony of trees in Utah considered the largest organism on Earth, is shrinking partly because of failed attempts by humans to keep it preserved, a new study suggests. The Pando… [+1552 chars]

articles.description: The new documentary 'I Am Big Bird' profiles Caroll Spinney, the actor who has embodied 'Sesame Street''s famous Big Bird for decades.

articles.author: KPNX, KPNX
articles.title: Man trapped in Arizona mine shaft for days, rescued
articles.description: After about five hours of rescue efforts, John Waddell, 62, pulled out of a 100-foot mine shaft in rural Arizona. He was found by his friend, Terry Shrader. Waddell was flown to a nearby hospital for emergency treatment.
